image.altText: A newspaper headline from the 1960s says reads "Spy Ring Plan, sought rocket secrets".

props.synopsis: Intelligence agencies, politicians and spies offer support for a proposed National Spy Museum in Canberra, which would portray the nation's history of espionage and pay tribute to those who have spied.

title.children: Proposed National Spy Museum to portray Australia's history of espionage

image.altText: A woman in black walks quickly past a camera, accompanied by another woman in black holding files.

props.synopsis: A former Canberra student teacher convicted by a jury of sexual offences against a 15-year-old boy she first met on a teaching practical has been spared jail.

title.children: Former student teacher avoids jail for sexual offences against teen

image.altText: A can of Coca-Cola with a plus one dollar label on it and two cans of Jim Beam with plus two dollar labels on it.

props.synopsis: When Ukraine's president faced a fiery meeting with Donald Trump at the White House, his plight struck a chord with a couple 16,000 kilometres away in rural Australia.

title.children: Yass Valley cafe imposes US drink tax over Trump's 'schoolyard bullying'

image.altText: A digital sign that says "London Circuit Closure 12 March" on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The eastern side of London Circuit closed last night until late 2026 to allow for light rail construction and footpath improvements, but the businesses affected are feeling positive about the construction "because we'll have a far more modernised area to work from".

title.children: Business owners optimistic as another section of London Circuit closes

image.altText: A black and white cat sits on a fence post in front of rolling hills

props.synopsis: For thousands of years farmers have kept cats for their talents at catching rats and mice, and now there are calls for people working the land to be able to claim tax deductions their health and upkeep,

title.children: Working dogs are famous but what about working cats?

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: A Canberra man who made violent threats and sent images of bullets and what looked like a pipe bomb to his ex-wife, is allowed to serve his sentence in the community.

title.children: Canberra man who sent ex-wife violent threats allowed to walk free

image.altText: Jacinta Klein

props.synopsis: About 100 undergraduate and Masters teaching students in the ACT are in classrooms without supervision, in a program designed to help with the chronic teacher shortage. But does putting them in the classrooms earlier lead to burn out faster?

title.children: 'There was something missing': The students already teaching

image.altText: Two Indigenous women smile at the camera in a composite image that includes a black and white photo and red desert.

props.synopsis: It has been more than 40 years since the Pintupi Nine made contact with the modern world. Much has changed in their lives, but their country has never stopped calling them home.

title.children: For years, these sisters didn't know white people existed

image.altText: A cargo ship at sea with many colourful containers.

props.synopsis: If the events of the past few weeks have proven anything, it is that free trade agreements are worthless, at least when it comes to trade.

title.children: How America ripped off Australia with 'free trade'

image.altText: A mugshot style photo of a man in his twenties in a tshirt

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals police may have failed to identify another victim of convicted healthcare killer Garry Davis, who was found guilty of murdering two nursing home residents and attempting to kill a third by injecting them with lethal doses of insulin.

title.children: Retired detective queries police investigation of aged care killer

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Wendy Williams tossed a note pleading for help from the window of the assisted care facility where she's been living for three years, reopening a debate about legal guardianships in the US.

title.children: This TV host is under a Britney-style guardianship. She's pleading for help

image.altText: Lando Norris driving his McLaren during Australian Formula One Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the Australian Grand Prix have been dashed after spinning out while running second. Follow live.

title.children: Piastri spins late as teammate Norris claims dramatic Australian Grand Prix

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Race report: Piastri cursed by team orders and late spin
LANDO NORRIS WINS THE AUSTRALIAN GRAND PRIX

image.altText: Steven Spurrier (right) holds up a wine glass with red wine it.

props.synopsis: Almost 50 years ago, American wine faced its first David vs Goliath moment against Europe. Now the pair are bracing for their next big battle.

title.children: Europe and the US are in the midst of a wine war. It's not their first

image.altText: A couple with their premature baby

props.synopsis: As Tropical Cyclone Alfred neared the Queensland coast, toppling trees and downing powerlines, more than 2000 health workers in the state's south bunkered down in hospitals to ensure patients were well cared for.

title.children: Mum thanks hospital staff after cyclone keeps her from her baby

image.altText: Burned out and dizzy female person with hands covering face. Vector illustration.

props.synopsis: Health anxiety, which is characterised by excessive worrying about illness, is a real condition that can — somewhat ironically — make you sick. But it's also treatable.

title.children: 'It's debilitating': How Dr Google can make you sick

image.altText: Two boats can be seen searching along the river.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for a 23-year-old man after he slipped into Brisbane River early this morning, failing to resurface.

title.children: Police scouring Brisbane River for man in his 20s

image.altText: A group of Yemeni men and boys hold up rifles in protest as they shout slogans.

props.synopsis: The strikes are the first to hit Yemen since the Gaza ceasefire deal took effect in January, and signal a more aggressive approach from the US, which has previously limited its actions to degrading the Houthis' ability to carry out missile and drone attacks.

title.children: Trump orders strikes on Yemen's capital over attacks on Red Sea shipping

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man with strawberry blonde hair looks at the camera with a serious face.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, former NBL player Harry Froling was laying in a hospital bed fighting for his life. Now he's set on coming back better than ever.

title.children: After a sickening one-punch attack, Harry Froling was told he'd never play basketball again

image.altText: A wing mirror on a car showing a hand on a driving wheel in the reflection.

props.synopsis: Tom takes medicinal cannabis for a bowel condition, but now he is weighing up his options because of a fine he copped for driving with THC in his system.

title.children: Calls for change after driver not at fault in crash charged by police

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands behind a lectern looking stern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has reiterated Australia's support for Ukraine after attending a virtual meeting with other world leaders to drum up support for ceasefire discussions.

title.children: Labor and Coalition reiterate opposing stances on Ukraine peacekeeping

image.altText: A woman in a yellow top and teens clutches her stomach on a couch

props.synopsis: The contraceptive pill Slinda, endometriosis treatment Ryego and an IVF drug will be made cheaper via the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, the Albanese government will announce.

title.children: Costs to be slashed on new endometriosis drug, IVF and contraceptive pill

image.altText: A woman holds her baby.

props.synopsis: Anna Fenton had to travel more than two hours to access an ultrasound during an ectopic pregnancy. Now, a petition before the NSW parliament is calling for an inquiry into regional and rural maternity care.

title.children: Rural women feel 'abandoned' by declining maternity services

image.altText: An aerial view of a house is destroyed by storm with lots of debris

props.synopsis: A massive storm system moving across the country has triggered deadly dust storms, tornadoes and fanned more than 100 wildfires.

title.children: At least 26 killed by storms and tornadoes in US as extreme weather threatens millions

image.altText: A white man with cropped hair and glasses wearing a blue shirt stands with his hands in his pockets against a wall

props.synopsis: Robert Lukins' third novel is a Succession-like saga set in a wealthy enclave in Connecticut in the 1990s.

title.children: Author admits 'monstrous' characters are drawn from himself

image.altText: A Culex quinquefasciatus mosquito

props.synopsis: Health officials have warned people in recently flooded areas of the country to protect against mosquito-borne diseases after a new case of Japanese encephalitis was detected in NSW.

title.children: Why Japanese encephalitis cases are rising in Australia

image.altText: A small boat heads towards a turbine in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Offshore wind faces community and political opposition as well support for its promise of ample renewable energy and while some claims can be ruled out, experts say other concerns are valid.

title.children: Do offshore turbines kill whales? Wind farm facts, fiction and unknowns

image.altText: Swiatek

props.synopsis: Iga Swiatek loses her cool and smashes a ball back at a ball kid in an ugly incident during the Indian Wells Open semifinal.

title.children: Swiatek booed after ugly incident with ball kid at Indian Wells

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Back again? I doubt you'll do any better than last week.

title.children: You better believe I’m here to judge you. Let’s play… HARD!

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wears a white cap and shirt and rests her chin on her hand, looking off camera in a park, smiling.

props.synopsis: As running clubs soared in popularity after the pandemic, Ash, a non-runner, struggled to find her own community — so she started a walking club.

title.children: After running clubs exploded, Ash started a walking club

image.altText: Henry Pollock screams

props.synopsis: The squad for the upcoming Lions tour of Australia is looking clearer after a wild night of results in the Six Nations.

title.children: Potential Lions squad becomes clearer as England humiliate Wales at Six Nations

image.altText: a man, woman and child pose out the front of a pub

props.synopsis: In the southern Queensland town of Laidley, floodwaters come and go but the people stay.

title.children: The town that keeps flooding but no-one wants to leave

image.altText: A woman uses virtual reality sticks to navigate an AI situation in virtual reality goggles.

props.synopsis: A training program to help combat a "national crisis" of rising hospital violence puts emergency department workers into situations with virtual aggressive patients.

title.children: Virtual 'code black' pits hospital staff against nightmare patient

image.altText: Starbucks has said it plans to appeal the verdict.

props.synopsis: The negligence lawsuit blamed the man's injuries on Starbucks, saying that an employee didn't wedge the scalding-hot tea firmly enough into a take-out tray.

title.children: US delivery driver wins $79 million in lawsuit over burns from Starbucks tea

image.altText: Two men dressed in hickory golf attire.

props.synopsis: Hickory golf is a game in which attention to your dress attire is as important as the shots you fire.

title.children: Golfers 'hooked' on hickories keep antique wooden clubs in full swing
